meanings.sent1: After a long day at work, he likes to imbibe a cold beer.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to imbibe too much alcohol in one sitting.
meanings.sent3: The party guests were eager to imbibe the festive cocktails.
meanings.sent4: She could not resist the temptation to imbibe the rich red wine.
meanings.sent5: The group gathered around the campfire to imbibe the warm cider.

meanings.definition: To absorb or take in something, such as knowledge or information
meanings.sent1: Students should imbibe the lessons taught in class to succeed.
meanings.sent2: Reading books is a great way to imbibe new ideas and perspectives.
meanings.sent3: The curious child tried to imbibe all the facts from the science exhibit.
meanings.sent4: Her mind seemed to naturally imbibe the complex theories presented.
meanings.sent5: To truly understand, one must imbibe the essence of the subject matter.
